oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Construction of the East Nashville Viaduct, 1923 April 01
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of African-American workmen excavating the west wing wall of the north abutment of the East Nashville Viaduct in the year 1923. This project of the Board of Public Works of the City of Nashville was based on the plans and specifications of Freeland, Roberts & Company, the consulting engineers. The Foster & Creighton construction contracting firm was founded in 1885 by Wilbur F. Foster and Robert T. Creighton, who had both served as City Engineer of Nashville. Forms part of the Foster & Creighton General Contractors Collection. 1 b & w photograph.
